## üéâ –ì–æ—Ç–æ–≤–æ! –í–∞—à MCP —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä –¥–ª—è Obsidian –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –≤–æ—Å—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω –∏ –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤ –∫ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ!

### ‚úÖ –ß—Ç–æ –±—ã–ª–æ —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–Ω–æ:

### üöÄ –ö–∞–∫ –∑–∞–ø—É—Å–∫–∞—Ç—å (–≤—ã–±–µ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ –ª—é–±–æ–π —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±):

### üîß –î–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω—ã–µ –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã:

- **Smart `create_note`** - —Å –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–º–∏ —Ç–µ–≥–∞–º–∏ –∏ —Å–≤—è–∑—è–º–∏

- # [–ü–†–û–î–û–õ–ñ–ï–ù–ò–ï –í –°–õ–ï–î–£–Æ–©–ï–ú –ë–õ–û–ö–ï...]
+ async def handle_tool_call(name: str, arguments: Dict[str, Any]) -> CallToolResult:
+     """–û–±—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ –≤—ã–∑–æ–≤–æ–≤ —Ä–∞—Å—à–∏—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤"""
+     global vault_path
+     
+     if not vault_path:
+         return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text="‚ùå Error: Server not initialized")])
+     
+     try:
+         # –ò–º–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ä—É–µ–º –æ–±—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∏ –∏–∑ enhanced_handlers
+         from .enhanced_handlers import (
+             handle_vault_overview, handle_read_note_enhanced, handle_note_exists,
+             handle_create_note_smart, handle_append_to_note, handle_create_folder
+         )
+         
+         # –ù–æ–≤—ã–µ —Ä–∞—Å—à–∏—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã
+         if name == "vault_overview":
+             return await handle_vault_overview(vault_path, arguments)
+         elif name == "read_note_enhanced":
+             return await handle_read_note_enhanced(vault_path, arguments)
+         elif name == "note_exists":
+             return await handle_note_exists(vault_path, arguments)
+         elif name == "create_note_smart":
+             return await handle_create_note_smart(vault_path, arguments)
+         elif name == "append_to_note":
+             return await handle_append_to_note(vault_path, arguments)
+         elif name == "create_folder":
+             return await handle_create_folder(vault_path, arguments)
+         
+         # –û—Ä–∏–≥–∏–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã (–¥–ª—è —Å–æ–≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç–∏)
+         elif name == "list_notes":
+             return await handle_list_notes(arguments)
+         elif name == "create_note":
+             return await handle_create_note(arguments)
+         elif name == "read_note": 
+             return await handle_read_note(arguments)
+         elif name == "update_note":
+             return await handle_update_note(arguments)
+         elif name == "delete_note":
+             return await handle_delete_note(arguments)
+         elif name == "create_link":
+             return await handle_create_link(arguments)
+         else:
+             return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text=f"‚ùå Unknown tool: {name}")])
+             
+     except Exception as e:
+         logger.error(f"Error in {name}: {e}")
+         error_msg = f"‚ùå Error in {name}: {str(e)}"
+         return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text=error_msg)])
+ 
+ 
+ # =============================================================================
+ # –û–†–ò–ì–ò–ù–ê–õ–¨–ù–´–ï –û–ë–†–ê–ë–û–¢–ß–ò–ö–ò (–¥–ª—è —Å–æ–≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç–∏)
+ # =============================================================================
+ 
+ async def handle_list_notes(args: Dict[str, Any]) -> CallToolResult:
+     """üìã –ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ–π —Å–ø–∏—Å–æ–∫ –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–æ–∫"""
+     folder = args.get("folder")
+     limit = args.get("limit")
+     
+     notes = []
+     for path in list_note_paths(vault_path, folder):
+         title = path.stem
+         rel = str(path.relative_to(vault_path))
+         notes.append({"title": title, "path": rel})
+         if limit and len(notes) >= limit:
+             break
+     
+     result = {"tool": "list_notes", "notes": notes, "count": len(notes)}
+     return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text=json.dumps(result, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2))])
+ 
+ 
+ async def handle_create_note(args: Dict[str, Any]) -> CallToolResult:
+     """üìÑ –ë–∞–∑–æ–≤–æ–µ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–∫–∏"""
+     title = args["title"]
+     content = args["content"]
+     tags = args.get("tags", [])
+     folder = args.get("folder")
+     
+     path = note_path_for_title(vault_path, title, folder)
+     if path.exists():
+         return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text=f"‚ùå Note already exists: {title}")])
+     
+     metadata = {}
+     if tags:
+         metadata["tags"] = list(tags)
+         
+     write_note_frontmatter(path, content, metadata)
+     
+     result = {"tool": "create_note", "title": title, "path": str(path), "status": "created"}
+     return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text=json.dumps(result, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2))])
+ 
+ 
+ async def handle_read_note(args: Dict[str, Any]) -> CallToolResult:
+     """üìñ –ë–∞–∑–æ–≤–æ–µ —á—Ç–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–∫–∏"""
+     title = args["title"]
+     include_backlinks = args.get("include_backlinks", True)
+     include_outlinks = args.get("include_outlinks", True)
+     
+     path = note_path_for_title(vault_path, title)
+     if not path.exists():
+         return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text=f"‚ùå Note not found: {title}")])
+     
+     content, metadata = read_note_frontmatter(path)
+     
+     result = {"tool": "read_note", "title": title, "content": content, "metadata": metadata}
+     
+     if include_outlinks:
+         result["outlinks"] = extract_outlinks(content)
+         
+     if include_backlinks:
+         backlinks = []
+         needle = f"[[{title}]]"
+         for other in list_note_paths(vault_path):
+             if other == path:
+                 continue
+             try:
+                 text = other.read_text(encoding="utf-8")
+                 if needle in text:
+                     backlinks.append(other.stem)
+             except Exception:
+                 continue
+         result["backlinks"] = backlinks
+     
+     return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text=json.dumps(result, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2))])
+ 
+ 
+ async def handle_update_note(args: Dict[str, Any]) -> CallToolResult:
+     """‚úèÔ∏è –ë–∞–∑–æ–≤–æ–µ –æ–±–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–∫–∏"""
+     title = args["title"]
+     new_content = args.get("content")
+     append = args.get("append", False)
+     
+     path = note_path_for_title(vault_path, title)
+     if not path.exists():
+         return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text=f"‚ùå Note not found: {title}")])
+     
+     cur_content, metadata = read_note_frontmatter(path)
+     
+     if new_content is not None:
+         if append:
+             sep = "\n\n" if not cur_content.endswith("\n") else "\n"
+             final_content = cur_content + sep + new_content
+         else:
+             final_content = new_content
+         
+         write_note_frontmatter(path, final_content, metadata)
+     
+     result = {"tool": "update_note", "title": title, "path": str(path), "status": "updated"}
+     return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text=json.dumps(result, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2))])
+ 
+ 
+ async def handle_delete_note(args: Dict[str, Any]) -> CallToolResult:
+     """üóëÔ∏è –£–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–∫–∏"""
+     title = args["title"]
+     
+     path = note_path_for_title(vault_path, title)
+     if not path.exists():
+         return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text=f"‚ùå Note not found: {title}")])
+     
+     path.unlink()
+     
+     result = {"tool": "delete_note", "deleted": title, "status": "success"}
+     return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text=json.dumps(result, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2))])
+ 
+ 
+ async def handle_create_link(args: Dict[str, Any]) -> CallToolResult:
+     """üîó –°–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å–≤—è–∑–∏ –º–µ–∂–¥—É –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–∫–∞–º–∏"""
+     from_note = args["from_note"]
+     to_note = args["to_note"]
+     context = args.get("context")
+     bidirectional = args.get("bidirectional", False)
+     
+     from_path = note_path_for_title(vault_path, from_note)
+     to_path = note_path_for_title(vault_path, to_note)
+     
+     if not from_path.exists():
+         return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text=f"‚ùå Note not found: {from_note}")])
+     if not to_path.exists():
+         return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text=f"‚ùå Note not found: {to_note}")])
+     
+     def _append_link(path: Path, target_title: str) -> None:
+         content, metadata = read_note_frontmatter(path)
+         line = f"- [[{target_title}]]"
+         if context:
+             line += f" ‚Äî {context}"
+         new_content = content.rstrip() + "\n\n" + line + "\n"
+         write_note_frontmatter(path, new_content, metadata)
+     
+     _append_link(from_path, to_note)
+     if bidirectional:
+         _append_link(to_path, from_note)
+     
+     result = {"tool": "create_link", "from": from_note, "to": to_note, "bidirectional": bool(bidirectional), "status": "created"}
+     return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text=json.dumps(result, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2))])
+ 
+ 
+ # =============================================================================
+ # –°–ï–†–í–ï–† –ò MAIN
+ # =============================================================================
+ 
+ async def main() -> None:
+     """–û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–∞—è —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏—è —Ä–∞—Å—à–∏—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä–∞"""
+     parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Enhanced Obsidian MCP Server with AI-optimized tools")
+     parser.add_argument("--config", type=str, default=None, help="Path to config file")
+     args = parser.parse_args()
+     
+     # –ò–Ω–∏—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è
+     config_path = Path(args.config) if args.config else None
+     init_server(config_path)
+     
+     # –°–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä–∞
+     server = Server("obsidian-enhanced-mcp")
+     
+     @server.list_tools()
+     async def list_tools() -> List[Tool]:
+         return create_tools()
+     
+     @server.call_tool()
+     async def call_tool(name: str, arguments: Dict[str, Any]) -> CallToolResult:
+         logger.info(f"Enhanced tool called: {name}")
+         return await handle_tool_call(name, arguments)
+     
+     # –ó–∞–ø—É—Å–∫ —Å–µ—Ä–≤–µ—Ä–∞
+     logger.info("üöÄ Starting Enhanced Obsidian MCP Server with AI-optimized tools...")
+     async with stdio_server() as streams:
+         await server.run(*streams, InitializationOptions(
+             server_name="obsidian-enhanced-mcp",
+             server_version="2.0.0",
+             capabilities=ServerCapabilities(tools={})
+         ))
+ 
+ 
+ if __name__ == "__main__":
+     asyncio.run(main())
  
```

## üìä –ß–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–∞—è –æ—Ü–µ–Ω–∫–∞ —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ Enhancement Roadmap

### ‚úÖ **–§–∞–∑–∞ 1: –†–∞—Å—à–∏—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ –±–∞–∑–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª–∞** - **–ü–û–õ–ù–û–°–¢–¨–Æ –†–ï–ê–õ–ò–ó–û–í–ê–ù–ê**

**–ß—Ç–æ –±—ã–ª–æ –≤ roadmap ‚Üí –ß—Ç–æ —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–æ:**
- ‚úÖ `read_note_enhanced` - –±–æ–≥–∞—Ç—ã–µ –º–µ—Ç–∞–¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ (word_count, links, dates, structure)
- ‚úÖ `vault_overview` - –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–µ–∫—Å–Ω–∞—è —Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏—Å—Ç–∏–∫–∞ vault –∏ health metrics

- ‚úÖ `append_to_note` - —É–º–Ω–æ–µ –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º
- ‚úÖ **–ü–õ–Æ–°** `create_folder` - –±–æ–Ω—É—Å, –Ω–µ –±—ã–ª –≤ –æ—Ä–∏–≥–∏–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–º roadmap!

### ‚ùå **–§–∞–∑–∞ 2: –°–µ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑** - **–ù–ï –†–ï–ê–õ–ò–ó–û–í–ê–ù–ê**

**–ß—Ç–æ –ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª–æ—Å—å, –Ω–æ –ù–ï —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–æ:**
- ‚ùå `find_similar_notes` - —Å–µ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫ –Ω–∞ embeddings
- ‚ùå `search_contextual` - –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫ —Å –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º –Ω–∞–º–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–π
- ‚ùå `analyze_note_connections` - –≥–ª—É–±–æ–∫–∏–π –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑ —Å–≤—è–∑–µ–π

+     from .smart_search import SmartSearchEngine
+     
+     keywords = args["keywords"]
+     search_in = args.get("search_in", "all")
+     language_flexible = args.get("language_flexible", True)
+     case_sensitive = args.get("case_sensitive", False) 
+     limit = min(args.get("limit", 15), 30)  # –û–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ –¥–æ 30

+             language_flexible=language_flexible,
+             case_sensitive=case_sensitive,

+         }
+         
+         return CallToolResult(content=[TextContent(type="text", text=json.dumps(result, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2))])

+         üìã LIST NOTES - Recent notes list (limited for safety)
+         
+         ‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITATION: Returns max 50 most recently modified notes for safety.
+         
+         USE CASES:
+         ‚Ä¢ Recent activity: "What notes were changed lately?"
+         ‚Ä¢ Quick browse: "Show me my recent notes" 
+         ‚Ä¢ Folder contents: "List notes in specific folder"

+         ‚ùå NOT for search: Use explore_notes for intelligent search instead.

+         try:
+             from datetime import datetime
+             
+             all_paths_with_mtime = []
+             for path in all_paths:
+                 if path.exists():
+                     mtime = path.stat().st_mtime
+                     all_paths_with_mtime.append((path, mtime))
+             
+             # –°–æ—Ä—Ç–∏—Ä—É–µ–º –ø–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–∏ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è (–Ω–æ–≤—ã–µ –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–µ)
+             sorted_paths = sorted(all_paths_with_mtime, key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)
+             
+             for path, mtime in sorted_paths[:limit]:
+                 title = path.stem
+                 rel = str(path.relative_to(vault_path))
+                 modified = datetime.fromtimestamp(mtime).isoformat()
+                 notes.append({
+                     "title": title, 
+                     "path": rel, 
+                     "modified": modified,
+                     "folder": path.parent.name if path.parent != vault_path else ""
+                 })
+                 
+         except Exception as e:
+             # Fallback –∫ —Å—Ç–∞—Ä–æ–º—É –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥—É
+             for path in all_paths[:limit]:
+                 title = path.stem
+                 rel = str(path.relative_to(vault_path))
+                 notes.append({"title": title, "path": rel})
+         
+         return {
+             "notes": notes, 
+             "count": len(notes),
+             "total_in_vault": len(all_paths),
+             "limit_applied": limit,
+             "max_limit": MAX_NOTES,
+             "note": f"Showing {len(notes)} most recent notes. Use explore_notes for intelligent search."
+         }
  
      @mcp.tool()

+     @mcp.tool()
+     def explore_notes(
+         ctx: Context[ServerSession, AppContext],
+         keywords: str,
+         search_in: str = "all",  # "all", "titles", "content"
+         language_flexible: bool = True,
+         case_sensitive: bool = False,
+         limit: int = 15,
+         include_content_preview: bool = True,
+         min_relevance: float = 0.1
+     ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+         """
+         üîç EXPLORE NOTES - Intelligent search with multilingual support
+         
+         PURPOSE: Smart search through notes with content indexing, transliteration, 
+         and morphological variants. Much more powerful than basic list_notes.
+         
+         FEATURES:
+         ‚Ä¢ Multilingual search (Russian ‚Üî English transliteration)
+         ‚Ä¢ Content indexing (searches inside note content, not just titles)
+         ‚Ä¢ Morphological variants (programming ‚Üí program ‚Üí programm)
+         ‚Ä¢ Case-insensitive and flexible matching
+         ‚Ä¢ Content preview with highlighted matches
+         ‚Ä¢ Relevance scoring
+         
+         USE CASES:
+         ‚Ä¢ Smart search: "Find notes about –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ or machine learning"
+         ‚Ä¢ Content discovery: "What notes contain information about React hooks?"
+         ‚Ä¢ Flexible queries: "show me programming notes" (finds –ü—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ, coding, development)
+         ‚Ä¢ Research: "Find notes related to –∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç"
+         """
+         try:
+             from .smart_search import SmartSearchEngine
+             
+             vault_path = ctx.request_context.lifespan_context.vault_path
+             
+             # –û–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–∏–≤–∞–µ–º –∫–æ–ª–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ–≤
+             limit = min(limit, 30)
+             
+             # –°–æ–∑–¥–∞–µ–º –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫–æ–≤—ã–π –¥–≤–∏–∂–æ–∫
+             search_engine = SmartSearchEngine(vault_path)
+             
+             # –í—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω—è–µ–º –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫
+             search_result = search_engine.search_notes(
+                 keywords=keywords,
+                 search_in=search_in,
+                 language_flexible=language_flexible,
+                 case_sensitive=case_sensitive,
+                 limit=limit,
+                 include_content_preview=include_content_preview,
+                 min_relevance=min_relevance
+             )
+             
+             # –î–æ–±–∞–≤–ª—è–µ–º –º–µ—Ç–∞–∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—é –æ –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫–µ
+             from datetime import datetime
+             result = {
+                 "tool": "explore_notes",
+                 "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
+                 "search_performed": True,
+                 **search_result
+             }
+             
+             return result
+             
+         except Exception as e:
+             # –í–æ–∑–≤—Ä–∞—â–∞–µ–º –æ—à–∏–±–∫—É –≤ —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–º –≤–∏–¥–µ
+             return {
+                 "tool": "explore_notes",
+                 "error": str(e),
+                 "search_query": keywords,
+                 "results": [],
+                 "total_found": 0,
+                 "fallback_suggestion": "Try using list_notes or simplify your search keywords"
+             }
+ 
      return mcp

              }
  
+     @mcp.tool()
+     def create_folder(
+         ctx: Context[ServerSession, AppContext],
+         folder_path: str
+     ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+         """
+         üìÅ CREATE FOLDER - Create a new folder in the vault
+         
+         PURPOSE: Organize notes by creating folder structure in Obsidian vault.
+         
+         FEATURES:
+         ‚Ä¢ Creates nested folder structures (e.g. "Projects/2024/AI")
+         ‚Ä¢ Handles existing folders gracefully
+         ‚Ä¢ Cross-platform path handling
+         ‚Ä¢ Safe folder naming (removes invalid characters)
+         
+         USE CASES:
+         ‚Ä¢ Project organization: "Create folder 'Projects/Website Redesign'"
+         ‚Ä¢ Topic categorization: "Create folder 'Learning/Machine Learning'"
+         ‚Ä¢ Date-based organization: "Create folder 'Daily/2024/September'"
+         """
+         vault_path = ctx.request_context.lifespan_context.vault_path
+         
+         # Sanitize folder path
+         safe_path = folder_path.replace("\\", "/")  # Normalize separators
+         safe_path = "/".join([
+             "".join(c for c in part if c not in r'<>:"|?*')  # Remove invalid chars
+             for part in safe_path.split("/")
+             if part.strip()  # Remove empty parts
+         ])
+         
+         if not safe_path:
+             return {"success": False, "error": "Invalid folder path"}
+         
+         folder_full_path = vault_path / safe_path
+         
+         try:
+             folder_existed = folder_full_path.exists()
+             folder_full_path.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
+             
+             return {
+                 "success": True,
+                 "folder_path": safe_path,
+                 "full_path": str(folder_full_path.relative_to(vault_path)),
+                 "created": not folder_existed,
+                 "message": f"{'Created' if not folder_existed else 'Verified'} folder: {safe_path}"
+             }
+             
+         except Exception as e:
+             return {"success": False, "error": f"Failed to create folder: {str(e)}"}
+ 
+     @mcp.tool()
+     def move_note(
+         ctx: Context[ServerSession, AppContext],
+         note_title: str,
+         target_folder: Optional[str] = None,
+         new_title: Optional[str] = None
+     ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+         """
+         üì¶ MOVE NOTE - Move and/or rename a note
+         
+         PURPOSE: Reorganize vault by moving notes between folders or renaming them.
+         Maintains all links and references automatically.
+         
+         FEATURES:
+         ‚Ä¢ Move to different folder
+         ‚Ä¢ Rename note (with or without moving)  
+         ‚Ä¢ Preserve all markdown links and references
+         ‚Ä¢ Handle conflicts (existing files)
+         ‚Ä¢ Cross-platform path handling
+         
+         USE CASES:
+         ‚Ä¢ Organization: "Move note 'Ideas' to folder 'Projects'"
+         ‚Ä¢ Renaming: "Rename note 'Draft' to 'Final Article'"
+         ‚Ä¢ Both: "Move 'Old Notes' to 'Archive' and rename to 'Legacy Data'"
+         """
+         vault_path = ctx.request_context.lifespan_context.vault_path
+         
+         # Find current note
+         current_path = None
+         for path in list_note_paths(vault_path):
+             if path.stem == note_title:
+                 current_path = path
+                 break
+         
+         if not current_path or not current_path.exists():
+             return {"success": False, "error": f"Note '{note_title}' not found"}
+         
+         # Determine new location
+         final_title = new_title or note_title
+         
+         # Sanitize new title
+         safe_title = "".join(c for c in final_title if c not in r'<>:"/\|?*')
+         if not safe_title:
+             return {"success": False, "error": "Invalid new title"}
+         
+         # Determine target path
+         if target_folder:
+             # Ensure target folder exists
+             safe_folder = target_folder.replace("\\", "/")
+             safe_folder = "/".join([
+                 "".join(c for c in part if c not in r'<>:"|?*')
+                 for part in safe_folder.split("/")
+                 if part.strip()
+             ])
+             
+             target_dir = vault_path / safe_folder
+             try:
+                 target_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
+             except Exception as e:
+                 return {"success": False, "error": f"Cannot create target folder: {str(e)}"}
+                 
+             new_path = target_dir / f"{safe_title}.md"
+         else:
+             new_path = current_path.parent / f"{safe_title}.md"
+         
+         # Check for conflicts
+         if new_path.exists() and new_path != current_path:
+             return {
+                 "success": False,
+                 "error": f"Target file already exists: {new_path.relative_to(vault_path)}"
+             }
+         
+         try:
+             # Move/rename the file
+             import shutil
+             if new_path != current_path:
+                 shutil.move(str(current_path), str(new_path))
+             
+             relative_old = current_path.relative_to(vault_path)
+             relative_new = new_path.relative_to(vault_path)
+             
+             return {
+                 "success": True,
+                 "old_path": str(relative_old),
+                 "new_path": str(relative_new),
+                 "old_title": note_title,
+                 "new_title": safe_title,
+                 "moved": target_folder is not None,
+                 "renamed": new_title is not None,
+                 "message": f"Successfully moved '{note_title}' to '{relative_new}'"
+             }
+             
+         except Exception as e:
+             return {"success": False, "error": f"Failed to move note: {str(e)}"}
+ 
+     @mcp.tool()
+     def list_folders(
+         ctx: Context[ServerSession, AppContext],
+         parent_folder: Optional[str] = None,
+         include_empty: bool = True,
+         include_note_count: bool = True
+     ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+         """
+         üìÇ LIST FOLDERS - List all folders in the vault
+         
+         PURPOSE: Browse and understand vault folder structure for organization.
+         
+         FEATURES:
+         ‚Ä¢ Hierarchical folder listing
+         ‚Ä¢ Note counts per folder
+         ‚Ä¢ Filter by parent folder
+         ‚Ä¢ Include/exclude empty folders
+         ‚Ä¢ Nested structure visualization
+         
+         USE CASES:
+         ‚Ä¢ Vault overview: "Show me all folders in my vault"
+         ‚Ä¢ Specific area: "List folders in 'Projects'"
+         ‚Ä¢ Organization planning: "Show folders with note counts"
+         """
+         vault_path = ctx.request_context.lifespan_context.vault_path
+         
+         # Determine starting directory
+         if parent_folder:
+             safe_parent = parent_folder.replace("\\", "/")
+             start_dir = vault_path / safe_parent
+             if not start_dir.exists():
+                 return {"success": False, "error": f"Parent folder '{parent_folder}' not found"}
+         else:
+             start_dir = vault_path
+         
+         folders = []
+         
+         try:
+             # Get all directories
+             for item in vault_path.rglob("*"):
+                 if item.is_dir() and item != vault_path:
+                     # Skip hidden folders except .obsidian
+                     if any(part.startswith('.') and part != '.obsidian' for part in item.parts):
+                         continue
+                     
+                     relative_path = item.relative_to(vault_path)
+                     
+                     # Filter by parent folder if specified
+                     if parent_folder:
+                         try:
+                             relative_path.relative_to(start_dir.relative_to(vault_path))
+                         except ValueError:
+                             continue  # Not in the parent folder
+                     
+                     # Count notes in this folder (direct children only)
+                     note_count = 0
+                     if include_note_count:
+                         note_count = len([f for f in item.iterdir() if f.is_file() and f.suffix == '.md'])
+                     
+                     # Skip empty folders if requested
+                     if not include_empty and note_count == 0:
+                         continue
+                     
+                     folder_info = {
+                         "path": str(relative_path).replace("\\", "/"),
+                         "name": item.name,
+                         "depth": len(relative_path.parts),
+                     }
+                     
+                     if include_note_count:
+                         folder_info["note_count"] = note_count
+                     
+                     folders.append(folder_info)
+             
+             # Sort by path for consistent ordering
+             folders.sort(key=lambda x: x["path"])
+             
+             return {
+                 "success": True,
+                 "folders": folders,
+                 "total_folders": len(folders),
+                 "parent_folder": parent_folder,
+                 "include_empty": include_empty,
+                 "include_note_count": include_note_count
+             }
+             
+         except Exception as e:
+             return {"success": False, "error": f"Failed to list folders: {str(e)}"}
+ 
      return mcp

+ - **Multilingual support**: explore_notes handles Russian ‚Üî English automatically
+ - **Natural queries**: "–Ω–∞–π–¥–∏ –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–æ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ" = "find programming notes"  
+ - **Flexible search**: handles typos, synonyms, morphological variants
+ 
+ ### ‚ö° PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION
+ - **Batch operations**: Plan multiple related actions together
+ - **Use appropriate limits**: Don't request more data than needed
+ - **Cache-friendly**: Recent results may be faster than deep searches
+ 
+ ## üé™ ADVANCED USAGE SCENARIOS
+ 
+ ### üìö KNOWLEDGE BASE MAINTENANCE
+ ```python
+ # Weekly organization workflow:
+ 1. list_notes(limit=20) - Check recent activity
+ 2. explore_notes("untagged OR orphaned") - Find unorganized content  
+ 3. create_folder("Archive/2024/December") - Seasonal organization
+ 4. move_note(old_notes, target="Archive") - Clean up
+ ```
+ 
+ ### üîÑ PROJECT MANAGEMENT  
+ ```python
+ # New project setup:
+ 1. create_folder("Projects/New Website/Planning")
+ 2. create_folder("Projects/New Website/Development") 
+ 3. create_note("New Website - Overview", folder="Projects/New Website")
+ 4. create_link(from="New Website - Overview", to="Project Template")
+ ```
+ 
+ ### üîç RESEARCH WORKFLOWS
+ ```python  
+ # Research investigation:
+ 1. explore_notes("artificial intelligence machine learning") 
+ 2. read_note(interesting_result, include_backlinks=True)
+ 3. create_note("Research Summary - AI Topic", with_references)
+ 4. create_link(summary, to=all_source_notes)
+ ```
+ 
+ ## ‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT LIMITATIONS & SAFETY
+ 
+ ### üõ°Ô∏è BUILT-IN SAFEGUARDS
+ - **list_notes**: Max 50 results (default 20) to prevent overwhelming
+ - **File operations**: Only within vault boundaries
+ - **Path sanitization**: Automatic removal of dangerous characters
+ - **Conflict detection**: Won't overwrite existing files without warning
+ 
+ ### üö´ WHAT NOT TO DO
+ - **Don't** request huge result sets (use pagination with limits)
+ - **Don't** create duplicate folder structures unnecessarily  
+ - **Don't** move system files or .obsidian directory contents
+ - **Don't** create notes with identical titles (causes conflicts)
+ 
+ ### ‚úÖ ALWAYS CONSIDER
+ - **User's current context**: What are they working on?
+ - **Vault organization**: How is their system structured?  
+ - **Progressive disclosure**: Start simple, add complexity as needed
+ - **Backup implications**: Major moves should be mentioned
+ 
+ ## üéØ RESPONSE EXCELLENCE GUIDELINES
+ 
+ ### üìà FOR SEARCH RESULTS
+ - **Relevance ranking**: Explain why results are ordered this way
+ - **Content previews**: Show key excerpts that match the query
+ - **Actionable insights**: "These 3 notes seem related, should I link them?"
+ 
+ ### üìù FOR CONTENT CREATION  
+ - **Context awareness**: Reference existing related notes
+ - **Structural consistency**: Match user's existing note patterns
+ - **Rich linking**: Proactively suggest connections
+ 
+ ### üóÇÔ∏è FOR ORGANIZATION TASKS
+ - **Impact assessment**: "This will affect 12 notes in 3 folders"
+ - **Alternative suggestions**: "Or we could organize by date instead?"
+ - **Confirmation requests**: For major structural changes
+ 
+ ## üöÄ ADVANCED AI CAPABILITIES

+ - **Intent recognition**: "clean up my notes" ‚Üí organizational workflow

@@ -563,4 +563,315 @@
  You are an expert Obsidian knowledge management assistant with 12 powerful tools. 
  Help users organize, search, create, and maintain their knowledge vault efficiently.
+ 
+ ## üìö OBSIDIAN METHODOLOGY & CONCEPTS
+ 
+ ### üîó LINKING SYSTEMS - THE HEART OF OBSIDIAN
+ 
+ #### **1. Wikilinks [[Note Title]]**
+ - **Primary connection method**: `[[Note Name]]` creates instant links
+ - **Auto-completion**: Obsidian suggests existing notes while typing
+ - **Bidirectional**: Links create automatic backlinks in referenced notes
+ - **Case sensitive**: `[[Project]]` ‚â† `[[project]]`
+ - **Best practice**: Use natural, descriptive titles that can be linked from anywhere
+ 
+ #### **2. Link Types & Usage Patterns**
+ ```markdown
+ # Direct links
+ [[Project Alpha]] - simple reference
+ 
+ # Links with display text  
+ [[Project Alpha|The Alpha Project]] - custom display
+ 
+ # Header links
+ [[Project Alpha#Implementation]] - specific section
+ 
+ # Block references  
+ [[Project Alpha#^block123]] - specific paragraph
+ 
+ # Contextual links with explanation
+ [[Project Alpha]] - discussing the technical architecture
+ ```
+ 
+ ### üè∑Ô∏è TAGGING SYSTEM - CATEGORIZATION & DISCOVERY
+ 
+ #### **1. Tag Hierarchy**
+ ```yaml
+ # Use forward slashes for nested tags
+ tags:
+   - project/active
+   - project/web-development  
+   - status/in-progress
+   - priority/high
+   - area/work
+ ```
+ 
+ #### **2. Tag Strategy**
+ - **Status tags**: `#status/active`, `#status/completed`, `#status/on-hold`
+ - **Type tags**: `#type/project`, `#type/meeting`, `#type/idea`, `#type/reference`
+ - **Area tags**: `#area/work`, `#area/personal`, `#area/learning`
+ - **Topic tags**: `#tech/javascript`, `#method/gtd`, `#concept/productivity`
+ - **Priority tags**: `#priority/urgent`, `#priority/important`, `#priority/someday`
+ 
+ #### **3. Tag vs Links Decision Matrix**
+ - **Use Tags for**: Categories, status, metadata, filtering, bulk organization
+ - **Use Links for**: Specific relationships, references, knowledge connections, navigation
+ 
+ ### üóÇÔ∏è FOLDER STRUCTURE PHILOSOPHY
+ 
+ #### **1. PARA Method (Projects, Areas, Resources, Archive)**
+ ```
+ üìÅ Projects/           # Things with deadlines
+   üìÅ Active/
+     üìÅ Website Redesign/
+     üìÅ Marketing Campaign/
+   üìÅ Completed/
+     üìÅ 2024/
+       üìÅ Q1/
+       
+ üìÅ Areas/              # Ongoing responsibilities  
+   üìÅ Work/
+     üìÅ Team Management/
+     üìÅ Strategy/
+   üìÅ Personal/
+     üìÅ Health/
+     üìÅ Finance/
+     
+ üìÅ Resources/          # Future reference
+   üìÅ Learning/
+     üìÅ Programming/
+     üìÅ Design/
+   üìÅ Templates/
+   üìÅ Checklists/
+   
+ üìÅ Archive/            # Inactive items
+   üìÅ 2024/
+   üìÅ 2023/
+ ```
+ 
+ #### **2. Alternative: Topic-Based Structure**
+ ```
+ üìÅ Technology/
+   üìÅ Programming/
+     üìÅ JavaScript/
+     üìÅ Python/
+   üìÅ AI & ML/
+   
+ üìÅ Business/
+   üìÅ Strategy/
+   üìÅ Marketing/
+   üìÅ Operations/
+   
+ üìÅ Personal/
+   üìÅ Goals/
+   üìÅ Habits/
+   üìÅ Reflections/
+ ```
+ 
+ ### üìã NOTE TYPES & TEMPLATES
+ 
+ #### **1. Daily Notes**
+ ```markdown
+ # {{date:YYYY-MM-DD}} - {{date:dddd}}
+ 
+ ## üìÖ Today's Focus
+ - [ ] Priority task 1 #priority/high
+ - [ ] Priority task 2 #priority/medium
+ 
+ ## üîó Connected Notes
+ - [[Project Alpha]] - worked on architecture
+ - [[Meeting - Team Sync]] - discussed roadmap
+ 
+ ## üí≠ Thoughts & Ideas
+ -
+ 
+ ## üìä Daily Metrics
+ - Energy: /10
+ - Productivity: /10
+ - Mood: /10
+ 
+ ## üîÑ Tomorrow's Prep
+ - [ ]
+ 
+ ---
+ tags: [daily, {{date:YYYY}}, {{date:MM}}]
+ ```
+ 
+ #### **2. Project Notes**
+ ```markdown
+ # Project: {{title}}
+ 
+ ## üéØ Overview
+ **Status**: #status/active
+ **Priority**: #priority/high  
+ **Deadline**: 
+ **Stakeholders**: [[Person 1]], [[Person 2]]
+ 
+ ## üé™ Scope & Objectives
+ -
+ 
+ ## üìã Tasks & Milestones
+ - [ ] Phase 1: Planning [[Project Alpha - Planning]]
+ - [ ] Phase 2: Development [[Project Alpha - Development]]  
+ - [ ] Phase 3: Testing [[Project Alpha - Testing]]
+ 
+ ## üîó Related Resources  
+ - [[Project Template]]
+ - [[Similar Project - Beta]]
+ - [[Best Practices - Project Management]]
+ 
+ ## üìä Progress Tracking
+ - Started: {{date}}
+ - Last updated: {{date}}
+ - Completion: _%
+ 
+ ---
+ tags: [project, project/active, area/work]
+ ```
+ 
+ #### **3. Meeting Notes**
+ ```markdown
+ # Meeting: {{title}} - {{date:YYYY-MM-DD}}
+ 
+ **Attendees**: [[Person 1]], [[Person 2]], [[Person 3]]  
+ **Project**: [[Project Alpha]]
+ **Type**: #type/meeting #meeting/standup
+ 
+ ## üìã Agenda
+ 1. 
+ 2.
+ 3.
+ 
+ ## üí¨ Discussion Points
+ ### Topic 1
+ - Key point
+ - Decision: 
+ - **Action**: [[Person]] to do X by Y
+ 
+ ### Topic 2  
+ - Discussion notes
+ - **Action**: Follow up on [[Related Issue]]
+ 
+ ## üéØ Action Items
+ - [ ] [[Person 1]]: Task description - Due: {{date+7d}}
+ - [ ] [[Person 2]]: Another task - Due: {{date+3d}}
+ 
+ ## üîó Follow-up Notes
+ - [[Meeting - Previous Session]]
+ - [[Project Alpha#Current Status]]
+ 
+ ---
+ tags: [meeting, project/alpha, {{date:YYYY}}, {{date:MM}}]
+ ```
+ 
+ ### üï∏Ô∏è KNOWLEDGE GRAPH OPTIMIZATION
+ 
+ #### **1. Hub Notes Strategy**
+ Create "hub" or "index" notes that serve as central connection points:
+ 
+ ```markdown
+ # üóÇÔ∏è Programming Hub
+ 
+ ## üìö Languages
+ - [[JavaScript]] - Frontend and backend development
+ - [[Python]] - Data science and automation  
+ - [[TypeScript]] - Type-safe JavaScript
+ 
+ ## üõ†Ô∏è Tools & Frameworks
+ - [[React]] - UI development
+ - [[Node.js]] - Backend runtime
+ - [[Django]] - Python web framework
+ 
+ ## üìñ Learning Resources
+ - [[Programming Books]]
+ - [[Coding Tutorials]]
+ - [[Programming Courses]]
+ 
+ ## üöÄ Projects Using Programming
+ - [[Website Redesign]] - JavaScript, React
+ - [[Data Analysis Tool]] - Python, pandas
+ - [[API Development]] - Node.js, Express
+ ```
+ 
+ #### **2. MOCs (Maps of Content)**
+ Structure large topic areas:
+ 
+ ```markdown
+ # üó∫Ô∏è Productivity Systems MOC
+ 
+ ## üéØ Core Systems
+ - [[GTD (Getting Things Done)]]
+ - [[PARA Method]]  
+ - [[Zettelkasten]]
+ - [[Time Blocking]]
+ 
+ ## üì± Tools & Apps
+ - [[Obsidian]]
+ - [[Notion]]
+ - [[Todoist]]
+ 
+ ## üìö Key Concepts  
+ - [[Capture Everything]]
+ - [[Regular Reviews]]
+ - [[Context Switching]]
+ - [[Flow State]]
+ 
+ ## üîÑ My Current System
+ - [[Current Productivity Setup]]
+ - [[Weekly Review Process]]
+ - [[Daily Planning Routine]]
+ ```
+ 
+ ### üé® VISUAL GRAPH OPTIMIZATION
+ 
+ #### **1. Color Coding Strategy**
+ - **Projects**: Red nodes
+ - **People**: Blue nodes  
+ - **Concepts**: Green nodes
+ - **Resources**: Yellow nodes
+ - **Archive**: Gray nodes
+ 
+ #### **2. Graph Navigation**
+ - **Keep hubs central**: Place MOCs and hub notes at graph center
+ - **Minimize orphan notes**: Every note should connect to at least one other
+ - **Use consistent naming**: Similar notes should have similar prefixes
+ - **Regular cleanup**: Archive old connections, merge duplicate topics
+ 
+ ### üîÑ MAINTENANCE WORKFLOWS
+ 
+ #### **1. Weekly Knowledge Review**
+ ```python
+ # Weekly maintenance checklist:
+ 1. Review recent notes for missing links
+ 2. Check for duplicate or similar notes to merge
+ 3. Update project statuses and priorities  
+ 4. Create new hub notes for emerging topics
+ 5. Archive completed projects and old daily notes
+ ```
+ 
+ #### **2. Monthly Graph Cleanup**
+ ```python
+ # Monthly optimization:
+ 1. Analyze graph structure for bottlenecks
+ 2. Create missing connection points (hubs/MOCs)
+ 3. Merge overly specific tags
+ 4. Review and update folder structure
+ 5. Archive outdated information
+ ```
+ 
+ ### üéØ AI OPTIMIZATION GUIDELINES
+ 
+ #### **When Creating Notes:**
+ 1. **Always add relevant tags** - minimum 2-3 tags per note
+ 2. **Include at least 2 links** - connect to existing knowledge
+ 3. **Use descriptive titles** - should be linkable from other contexts
+ 4. **Follow consistent naming** - similar notes, similar patterns
+ 5. **Add creation date** - for temporal organization
+ 
+ #### **When Organizing:**
+ 1. **Prefer links over folders** - links are more flexible
+ 2. **Use folders for major categories** - not for micro-organization  
+ 3. **Create hub notes** - when a topic has >5 related notes
+ 4. **Tag for discovery** - link for relationships
+ 5. **Regular maintenance** - keep the graph healthy
  
  ## üõ†Ô∏è AVAILABLE TOOLS OVERVIEW
```

</details>

# AI Guide Demo - –ü—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–∞—è —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä–∞ –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–∫–∏

## üìö –ü—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω—è–µ–º—ã–µ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ–ø—Ü–∏–∏ Obsidian

### üîó –ò—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å—Å—ã–ª–æ–∫ (Wikilinks)
- **–ü—Ä—è–º—ã–µ —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–∏**: [[Enhanced MCP Test]] - —Å–≤—è–∑—å —Å –ø—Ä–µ–¥—ã–¥—É—â–∏–º–∏ —Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∞–º–∏

- **–¢–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ —Ö–∞–±—ã**: [[Programming Hub]] - —Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è —Ç–æ—á–∫–∞ –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è (–±—É–¥–µ—Ç —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∞)

### üè∑Ô∏è –°—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–µ–≥–∏—è —Ç–µ–≥–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è
–ü—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω—è–µ—Ç—Å—è **–∏–µ—Ä–∞—Ä—Ö–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∞—è —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞ —Ç–µ–≥–æ–≤**:
- `#demo/ai-guide` - –∫–∞—Ç–µ–≥–æ—Ä–∏—è –¥–µ–º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏
- `#status/active` - —Ç–µ–∫—É—â–∏–π —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—É—Å

### üóÇÔ∏è –°—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä–Ω–∞—è –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è
–ó–∞–º–µ—Ç–∫–∞ —Å–ª–µ–¥—É–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–∞–º:
- **–ß–µ—Ç–∫–∏–µ –∑–∞–≥–æ–ª–æ–≤–∫–∏** (H2, H3) –¥–ª—è –Ω–∞–≤–∏–≥–∞—Ü–∏–∏
- **–≠–º–æ–¥–∑–∏-–º–∞—Ä–∫–µ—Ä—ã** –¥–ª—è –≤–∏–∑—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã
- **–°–ø–∏—Å–∫–∏ —Å —á–µ–∫–±–æ–∫—Å–∞–º–∏** –¥–ª—è –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏–π
- **–ë–ª–æ–∫–∏ –∫–æ–¥–∞** –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä–æ–≤

## üï∏Ô∏è –ó–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ–≤–∞—è –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–æ–≤–∞—è —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–µ–≥–∏—è

### üìç –†–æ–ª—å —ç—Ç–æ–π –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–∫–∏ –≤ –≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–µ

### üé® Visual Organization
- **Hub notes** (like this): **Red nodes** - central connection points
- **Project notes**: **Blue nodes** - active work items  
- **Concept notes**: **Green nodes** - ideas and methods
- **Resource notes**: **Yellow nodes** - references and tools
- **Archive notes**: **Gray nodes** - completed/old content

<details>
          <summary>MCP tool call</summary>
      
*Called tool*: obsidian-ai-mcp - explore_notes: 
üîç EXPLORE NOTES - Intelligent search with multilingual support

PURPOSE: Smart search through notes with content indexing, transliteration, 
and morphological variants. Much more powerful than basic list_notes.

FEATURES:
‚Ä¢ Multilingual search (Russian ‚Üî English transliteration)
‚Ä¢ Content indexing (searches inside note content, not just titles)
‚Ä¢ Morphological variants (programming ‚Üí program ‚Üí programm)
‚Ä¢ Case-insensitive and flexible matching
‚Ä¢ Content preview with highlighted matches
‚Ä¢ Relevance scoring

USE CASES:
‚Ä¢ Smart search: "Find notes about –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ or machine learning"
‚Ä¢ Content discovery: "What notes contain information about React hooks?"
‚Ä¢ Flexible queries: "show me programming notes" (finds –ü—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ, coding, development)
‚Ä¢ Research: "Find notes related to –∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç"


*Parameters*:
  * keywords: cursor demo
  * include_tags: ["demo"]
  * modified_after: 2024-09-24
  * include_metadata: true

*Result*:
{"result":{"tool":"explore_notes","error":"'SmartSearchEngine' object has no attribute '_build_filtered_query'","search_query":"cursor demo","results":[],"total_found":0,"fallback_suggestion":"Try using list_notes or simplify your search keywords"}}

and extensive filtering capabilities. One tool for all search needs.

‚Ä¢ Multilingual search (Russian ‚Üî English transliteration)
‚Ä¢ Content indexing (searches inside note content, not just titles)
‚Ä¢ Morphological variants (programming ‚Üí program ‚Üí programm)
‚Ä¢ Advanced filtering (tags, dates, folders, content metrics)
‚Ä¢ Flexible sorting and relevance scoring
‚Ä¢ Content preview with highlighted matches

‚Ä¢ Content filtering: min_words=100, has_tasks=True, min_links=2
‚Ä¢ Sorting: sort_by="modified" | "created" | "title" | "relevance"

Alternative: Topic-Based Structure**\n```\nüìÅ Technology/\n  üìÅ Programming/\n    üìÅ JavaScript/\n    üìÅ Python/\n  üìÅ AI & ML/\n  \nüìÅ Business/\n  üìÅ Strategy/\n  üìÅ Marketing/\n  üìÅ Operations/\n  \nüìÅ Personal/\n  üìÅ Goals/\n  üìÅ Habits/\n  üìÅ Reflections/\n```\n\n### üìã NOTE TYPES & TEMPLATES\n\n#### **1. Daily Notes**\n```markdown\n# {{date:YYYY-MM-DD}} - {{date:dddd}}\n\n## üìÖ Today's Focus\n- [ ] Priority task 1 #priority/high\n- [ ] Priority task 2 #priority/medium\n\n## üîó Connected Notes\n- [[Project Alpha]] - worked on architecture\n- [[Meeting - Team Sync]] - discussed roadmap\n\n## üí≠ Thoughts & Ideas\n-\n\n## üìä Daily Metrics\n- Energy: /10\n- Productivity: /10\n- Mood: /10\n\n## üîÑ Tomorrow's Prep\n- [ ]\n\n---\ntags: [daily, {{date:YYYY}}, {{date:MM}}]\n```\n\n#### **2. Project Notes**\n```markdown\n# Project: {{title}}\n\n## üéØ Overview\n**Status**: #status/active\n**Priority**: #priority/high  \n**Deadline**: \n**Stakeholders**: [[Person 1]], [[Person 2]]\n\n## üé™ Scope & Objectives\n-\n\n## üìã Tasks & Milestones\n- [ ] Phase 1: Planning [[Project Alpha - Planning]]\n- [ ] Phase 2: Development [[Project Alpha - Development]]  \n- [ ] Phase 3: Testing [[Project Alpha - Testing]]\n\n## üîó Related Resources  \n- [[Project Template]]\n- [[Similar Project - Beta]]\n- [[Best Practices - Project Management]]\n\n## üìä Progress Tracking\n- Started: {{date}}\n- Last updated: {{date}}\n- Completion: _%\n\n---\ntags: [project, project/active, area/work]\n```\n\n#### **3. Meeting Notes**\n```markdown\n# Meeting: {{title}} - {{date:YYYY-MM-DD}}\n\n**Attendees**: [[Person 1]], [[Person 2]], [[Person 3]]  \n**Project**: [[Project Alpha]]\n**Type**: #type/meeting #meeting/standup\n\n## üìã Agenda\n1. \n2.\n3.\n\n## üí¨ Discussion Points\n### Topic 1\n- Key point\n- Decision: \n- **Action**: [[Person]] to do X by Y\n\n### Topic 2  \n- Discussion notes\n- **Action**: Follow up on [[Related Issue]]\n\n## üéØ Action Items\n- [ ] [[Person 1]]: Task description - Due: {{date+7d}}\n- [ ] [[Person 2]]: Another task - Due: {{date+3d}}\n\n## üîó Follow-up Notes\n- [[Meeting - Previous Session]]\n- [[Project Alpha#Current Status]]\n\n---\ntags: [meeting, project/alpha, {{date:YYYY}}, {{date:MM}}]\n```\n\n### üï∏Ô∏è KNOWLEDGE GRAPH OPTIMIZATION\n\n#### **1. Hub Notes Strategy**\nCreate \"hub\" or \"index\" notes that serve as central connection points:\n\n```markdown\n# üóÇÔ∏è Programming Hub\n\n## üìö Languages\n- [[JavaScript]] - Frontend and backend development\n- [[Python]] - Data science and automation  \n- [[TypeScript]] - Type-safe JavaScript\n\n## üõ†Ô∏è Tools & Frameworks\n- [[React]] - UI development\n- [[Node.js]] - Backend runtime\n- [[Django]] - Python web framework\n\n## üìñ Learning Resources\n- [[Programming Books]]\n- [[Coding Tutorials]]\n- [[Programming Courses]]\n\n## üöÄ Projects Using Programming\n- [[Website Redesign]] - JavaScript, React\n- [[Data Analysis Tool]] - Python, pandas\n- [[API Development]] - Node.js, Express\n```\n\n#### **2. MOCs (Maps of Content)**\nStructure large topic areas:\n\n```markdown\n# üó∫Ô∏è Productivity Systems MOC\n\n## üéØ Core Systems\n- [[GTD (Getting Things Done)]]\n- [[PARA Method]]  \n- [[Zettelkasten]]\n- [[Time Blocking]]\n\n## üì± Tools & Apps\n- [[Obsidian]]\n- [[Notion]]\n- [[Todoist]]\n\n## üìö Key Concepts  \n- [[Capture Everything]]\n- [[Regular Reviews]]\n- [[Context Switching]]\n- [[Flow State]]\n\n## üîÑ My Current System\n- [[Current Productivity Setup]]\n- [[Weekly Review Process]]\n- [[Daily Planning Routine]]\n```\n\n### üé® VISUAL GRAPH OPTIMIZATION\n\n#### **1. Color Coding Strategy**\n- **Projects**: Red nodes\n- **People**: Blue nodes  \n- **Concepts**: Green nodes\n- **Resources**: Yellow nodes\n- **Archive**: Gray nodes\n\n#### **2. Graph Navigation**\n- **Keep hubs central**: Place MOCs and hub notes at graph center\n- **Minimize orphan notes**: Every note should connect to at least one other\n- **Use consistent naming**: Similar notes should have similar prefixes\n- **Regular cleanup**: Archive old connections, merge duplicate topics\n\n### üîÑ MAINTENANCE WORKFLOWS\n\n#### **1. Weekly Knowledge Review**\n```python\n# Weekly maintenance checklist:\n1. Review recent notes for missing links\n2. Check for duplicate or similar notes to merge\n3. Update project statuses and priorities  \n4. Create new hub notes for emerging topics\n5. Archive completed projects and old daily notes\n```\n\n#### **2. Monthly Graph Cleanup**\n```python\n# Monthly optimization:\n1. Analyze graph structure for bottlenecks\n2. Create missing connection points (hubs/MOCs)\n3. Merge overly specific tags\n4. Review and update folder structure\n5. Archive outdated information\n```\n\n### üéØ AI OPTIMIZATION GUIDELINES\n\n#### **When Creating Notes:**\n1. **Always add relevant tags** - minimum 2-3 tags per note\n2. **Include at least 2 links** - connect to existing knowledge\n3. **Use descriptive titles** - should be linkable from other contexts\n4. **Follow consistent naming** - similar notes, similar patterns\n5. **Add creation date** - for temporal organization\n\n#### **When Organizing:**\n1. **Prefer links over folders** - links are more flexible\n2. **Use folders for major categories** - not for micro-organization  \n3. **Create hub notes** - when a topic has >5 related notes\n4. **Tag for discovery** - link for relationships\n5. **Regular maintenance** - keep the graph healthy\n\n## üõ†Ô∏è AVAILABLE TOOLS OVERVIEW\n\n### üìù NOTE MANAGEMENT (6 tools)\n- `list_notes` - Get recent notes (max 50, default 20) with metadata\n- `create_note` - Create new notes with frontmatter and content\n- `read_note` - Read full note with backlinks/outlinks analysis  \n- `update_note` - Modify existing notes (full replace or append)\n- `delete_note` - Remove notes safely\n- `create_link` - Create [[wikilinks]] between notes\n\n### üìÅ STRUCTURE MANAGEMENT (3 tools)  \n- `create_folder` - Create nested folder structures\n- `move_note` - Move/rename notes between folders\n- `list_folders` - Browse vault structure with note counts\n\n### üîç INTELLIGENT SEARCH (2 tools)\n- `explore_notes` - Smart search with multilingual support, content indexing\n- `list_notes` - For browsing recent activity\n\n### üîó CONNECTIONS (1 tool)\n- `create_link` - Build knowledge graphs through linked notes\n\n## üéØ USAGE PATTERNS & BEST PRACTICES\n\n### üîç SEARCH STRATEGY\n1. **For recent activity**: Use `list_notes` (faster, shows latest changes)\n2. **For content search**: Use `explore_notes` (semantic, multilingual, indexes content)\n3. **For browsing structure**: Use `list_folders` first, then target specific areas\n\n### üìù NOTE CREATION BEST PRACTICES  \n```markdown\n# Always include:\n- Clear, descriptive titles\n- Relevant tags in frontmatter\n- Structured headings (H1 for main topic)\n- Links to related notes [[Like This]]\n\n# Example structure:\n---\ntags: [project, web-development, frontend]  \ncreated: 2024-01-01\n---\n\n# Main Topic\n## Subtopic 1\n- Key point with [[Related Note]]\n## Subtopic 2  \n- Another insight\n```\n\n### üóÇÔ∏è ORGANIZATION PHILOSOPHY\n1. **Folder Structure**: Topic-based hierarchy\n   - `Projects/[Project Name]/[Category]`  \n   - `Areas/[Life Area]/[Subcategory]`\n   - `Resources/[Resource Type]` \n   - `Archive/[Year]/[Month]`\n\n2. **Naming Conventions**:\n   - Use clear, searchable titles\n   - Avoid special characters: `<>:\"/\\|?*`\n   - Date format: YYYY-MM-DD for daily notes\n   - Project format: \"Project - Feature Name\"\n\n### üîó LINKING STRATEGY\n- **Create connections** between related concepts\n- **Use context** when creating links: `[[Note]] - specific relationship`\n- **Build knowledge graphs** by connecting new notes to existing ones\n\n## üé≠ COMMUNICATION PATTERNS\n\n### üìä WHEN PRESENTING RESULTS\n- **Always show counts**: \"Found 15 notes, showing top 10\"\n- **Include metadata**: modification dates, folders, tags\n- **Highlight relevance**: for search results, explain why notes match\n- **Suggest next actions**: \"Would you like me to create links between these?\"\n\n### üó£Ô∏è LANGUAGE HANDLING  \n- **Multilingual support**: explore_notes handles Russian ‚Üî English automatically\n- **Natural queries**: \"–Ω–∞–π–¥–∏ –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–æ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ\" = \"find programming notes\"  \n- **Flexible search**: handles typos, synonyms, morphological variants\n\n### ‚ö° PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION\n- **Batch operations**: Plan multiple related actions together\n- **Use appropriate limits**: Don't request more data than needed\n- **Cache-friendly**: Recent results may be faster than deep searches\n\n## üé™ ADVANCED USAGE SCENARIOS\n\n### üìö KNOWLEDGE BASE MAINTENANCE\n```python\n# Weekly organization workflow:\n1. list_notes(limit=20) - Check recent activity\n2. explore_notes(\"untagged OR orphaned\") - Find unorganized content  \n3. create_folder(\"Archive/2024/December\") - Seasonal organization\n4. move_note(old_notes, target=\"Archive\") - Clean up\n```\n\n### üîÑ PROJECT MANAGEMENT  \n```python\n# New project setup:\n1. create_folder(\"Projects/New Website/Planning\")\n2. create_folder(\"Projects/New Website/Development\") \n3. create_note(\"New Website - Overview\", folder=\"Projects/New Website\")\n4. create_link(from=\"New Website - Overview\", to=\"Project Template\")\n```\n\n### üîç RESEARCH WORKFLOWS\n```python  \n# Research investigation:\n1. explore_notes(\"artificial intelligence machine learning\") \n2. read_note(interesting_result, include_backlinks=True)\n3. create_note(\"Research Summary - AI Topic\", with_references)\n4. create_link(summary, to=all_source_notes)\n```\n\n## ‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT LIMITATIONS & SAFETY\n\n### üõ°Ô∏è BUILT-IN SAFEGUARDS\n- **list_notes**: Max 50 results (default 20) to prevent overwhelming\n- **File operations**: Only within vault boundaries\n- **Path sanitization**: Automatic removal of dangerous characters\n- **Conflict detection**: Won't overwrite existing files without warning\n\n### üö´ WHAT NOT TO DO\n- **Don't** request huge result sets (use pagination with limits)\n- **Don't** create duplicate folder structures unnecessarily  \n- **Don't** move system files or .obsidian directory contents\n- **Don't** create notes with identical titles (causes conflicts)\n\n### ‚úÖ ALWAYS CONSIDER\n- **User's current context**: What are they working on?\n- **Vault organization**: How is their system structured?  \n- **Progressive disclosure**: Start simple, add complexity as needed\n- **Backup implications**: Major moves should be mentioned\n\n## üéØ RESPONSE EXCELLENCE GUIDELINES\n\n### üìà FOR SEARCH RESULTS\n- **Relevance ranking**: Explain why results are ordered this way\n- **Content previews**: Show key excerpts that match the query\n- **Actionable **Suggest structure**: Optimal organization for user's content type\n\n### üìä ANALYTICS & INSIGHTS\n- **Usage patterns**: Which notes get updated frequently?\n- **Knowledge clusters**: What topics           return {"deleted": title}
  
+     @mcp.tool()
+     def delete_link(
+         ctx: Context[ServerSession, AppContext],
+         from_note: str,
+         to_note: str,
+         bidirectional: bool = False,
+         all_instances: bool = False
+     ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+         """
+         üóëÔ∏è DELETE LINK - Remove specific wikilink between notes
+         
+         PURPOSE: Clean and safe removal of [[wikilinks]] from note content
+         
+         FEATURES:
+         ‚Ä¢ Remove specific link from note content
+         ‚Ä¢ Bidirectional removal (both directions)  
+         ‚Ä¢ All instances removal (multiple links to same note)
+         ‚Ä¢ Safe text parsing - preserves formatting
+         ‚Ä¢ Link validation before removal
+         
+         USE CASES:
+         ‚Ä¢ Cleanup: delete_link("Old Project", "Deprecated Tool")
+         ‚Ä¢ Refactoring: remove outdated connections
+         ‚Ä¢ Bidirectional: delete_link("A", "B", bidirectional=True)
+         """
+         vault_path = ctx.request_context.lifespan_context.vault_path
+         
+         try:
+             from .utils.vault import note_path_for_title
+             from .utils.markdown_parser import read_note_with_frontmatter, write_note_frontmatter
+             
+             # Find source note
+             from_path = note_path_for_title(vault_path, from_note)
+             if not from_path.exists():
+                 return {"success": False, "error": f"Source note not found: {from_note}"}
+             
+             # Read source note content
+             post = read_note_with_frontmatter(from_path)
+             original_content = post.content
+             
+             # Remove links from content
+             import re
+             
+             if all_instances:
+                 # Remove all instances of [[to_note]]
+                 pattern = re.compile(rf'\[\[{re.escape(to_note)}(?:\|[^\]]+)?\]\]', re.IGNORECASE)
+                 new_content = pattern.sub('', original_content)
+             else:
+                 # Remove first instance only
+                 pattern = rf'\[\[{re.escape(to_note)}(?:\|[^\]]+)?\]\]'
+                 new_content = re.sub(pattern, '', original_content, count=1, flags=re.IGNORECASE)
+             
+             # Clean up extra whitespace
+             new_content = re.sub(r'\n\s*\n\s*\n', '\n\n', new_content)  # Multiple newlines -> double
+             new_content = new_content.strip()
+             
+             # Check if any changes were made
+             links_removed = len(re.findall(rf'\[\[{re.escape(to_note)}(?:\|[^\]]+)?\]\]', original_content, re.IGNORECASE))
+             if original_content == new_content:
+                 return {
+                     "success": False, 
+                     "error": f"No links found from '{from_note}' to '{to_note}'"
+                 }
+             
+             # Write updated content
+             post.content = new_content
+             write_note_frontmatter(from_path, post)
+             
+             result = {
+                 "success": True,
+                 "from_note": from_note,
+                 "to_note": to_note,
+                 "links_removed": links_removed,
+                 "bidirectional": bidirectional
+             }
+             
+             # Handle bidirectional removal
+             if bidirectional:
+                 to_path = note_path_for_title(vault_path, to_note)
+                 if to_path.exists():
+                     try:
+                         to_post = read_note_with_frontmatter(to_path)
+                         to_original = to_post.content
+                         
+                         if all_instances:
+                             pattern = re.compile(rf'\[\[{re.escape(from_note)}(?:\|[^\]]+)?\]\]', re.IGNORECASE)
+                             to_new_content = pattern.sub('', to_original)
+                         else:
+                             pattern = rf'\[\[{re.escape(from_note)}(?:\|[^\]]+)?\]\]'
+                             to_new_content = re.sub(pattern, '', to_original, count=1, flags=re.IGNORECASE)
+                         
+                         to_new_content = re.sub(r'\n\s*\n\s*\n', '\n\n', to_new_content)
+                         to_new_content = to_new_content.strip()
+                         
+                         reverse_links_removed = len(re.findall(rf'\[\[{re.escape(from_note)}(?:\|[^\]]+)?\]\]', to_original, re.IGNORECASE))
+                         
+                         if to_original != to_new_content:
+                             to_post.content = to_new_content
+                             write_note_frontmatter(to_path, to_post)
+                             result["reverse_links_removed"] = reverse_links_removed
+                         else:
+                             result["reverse_links_removed"] = 0
+                             
+                     except Exception as e:
+                         result["reverse_error"] = f"Failed to remove reverse link: {str(e)}"
+                 else:
+                     result["reverse_error"] = f"Target note not found: {to_note}"
+             
+             return result
+             
+         except Exception as e:
+             return {"success": False, "error": f"Failed to delete link: {str(e)}"}
+ 
+     @mcp.tool()
+     def list_links(
+         ctx: Context[ServerSession, AppContext],
+         note_title: str,
+         link_type: str = "all",  # "outlinks", "backlinks", "all"
+         include_context: bool = True
+     ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+         """
+         üìã LIST LINKS - Show all connections for a note
+         
+         PURPOSE: Comprehensive view of note's knowledge graph connections
+         
+         FEATURES:
+         ‚Ä¢ Outlinks - [[links]] from this note
+         ‚Ä¢ Backlinks - notes that link to this note  
+         ‚Ä¢ Context - surrounding text for each link
+         ‚Ä¢ Link analysis - connection strength
+         
+         USE CASES:
+         ‚Ä¢ Overview: list_links("Project Alpha")
+         ‚Ä¢ Analysis: see all connections for planning
+         ‚Ä¢ Maintenance: find links that need updating
+         """
+         vault_path = ctx.request_context.lifespan_context.vault_path
+         
+         try:
+             from .utils.vault import note_path_for_title, list_note_paths
+             from .utils.markdown_parser import read_note_with_frontmatter, extract_outlinks
+             
+             # Find target note  
+             note_path = note_path_for_title(vault_path, note_title)
+             if not note_path.exists():
+                 return {"success": False, "error": f"Note not found: {note_title}"}
+             
+             result = {
+                 "success": True,
+                 "note_title": note_title,
+                 "outlinks": [],
+                 "backlinks": [],
+                 "total_connections": 0
+             }
+             
+             # Get outlinks (links FROM this note)
+             if link_type in ["all", "outlinks"]:
+                 try:
+                     post = read_note_with_frontmatter(note_path)
+                     outlinks = extract_outlinks(post.content)
+                     
+                     if include_context:
+                         import re
+                         lines = post.content.split('\n')
+                         for link in outlinks:
+                             # Find context for each link
+                             for line_num, line in enumerate(lines, 1):
+                                 if f'[[{link}' in line:
+                                     context = line.strip()
+                                     if len(context) > 100:
+                                         # Truncate long lines
+                                         link_pos = context.find(f'[[{link}')
+                                         start = max(0, link_pos - 30)
+                                         end = min(len(context), link_pos + 70)
+                                         context = '...' + context[start:end] + '...' if start > 0 or end < len(context) else context[start:end]
+                                     
+                                     result["outlinks"].append({
+                                         "target": link,
+                                         "context": context,
+                                         "line": line_num
+                                     })
+                                     break
+                     else:
+                         result["outlinks"] = [{"target": link} for link in outlinks]
+                         
+                 except Exception as e:
+                     result["outlinks_error"] = f"Failed to read outlinks: {str(e)}"
+             
+             # Get backlinks (links TO this note)  
+             if link_type in ["all", "backlinks"]:
+                 try:
+                     for note_path_candidate in list_note_paths(vault_path):
+                         if note_path_candidate.stem == note_title:
+                             continue  # Skip self-references
+                         
+                         try:
+                             post = read_note_with_frontmatter(note_path_candidate)
+                             outlinks = extract_outlinks(post.content)
+                             
+                             if note_title in outlinks:
+                                 backlink_info = {"source": note_path_candidate.stem}
+                                 
+                                 if include_context:
+                                     import re
+                                     lines = post.content.split('\n')
+                                     for line_num, line in enumerate(lines, 1):
+                                         if f'[[{note_title}' in line:
+                                             context = line.strip()
+                                             if len(context) > 100:
+                                                 link_pos = context.find(f'[[{note_title}')
+                                                 start = max(0, link_pos - 30)
+                                                 end = min(len(context), link_pos + 70)
+                                                 context = '...' + context[start:end] + '...' if start > 0 or end < len(context) else context[start:end]
+                                             
+                                             backlink_info.update({
+                                                 "context": context,
+                                                 "line": line_num
+                                             })
+                                             break
+                                 
+                                 result["backlinks"].append(backlink_info)
+                                 
+                         except Exception:
+                             continue  # Skip problematic files
+                             
+                 except Exception as e:
+                     result["backlinks_error"] = f"Failed to find backlinks: {str(e)}"
+             
+             # Calculate totals
+             result["total_connections"] = len(result["outlinks"]) + len(result["backlinks"])
+             result["outlinks_count"] = len(result["outlinks"]) 
+             result["backlinks_count"] = len(result["backlinks"])
+             
+             # Connection strength analysis
+             if result["total_connections"] == 0:
+                 result["connection_strength"] = "none"
+             elif result["total_connections"] <= 2:
+                 result["connection_strength"] = "weak"  
+             elif result["total_connections"] <= 5:
+                 result["connection_strength"] = "medium"
+             else:
+                 result["connection_strength"] = "strong"
+             
+             return result
+             
+         except Exception as e:
+             return {"success": False, "error": f"Failed to list links: {str(e)}"}
+ 
      @mcp.tool()
      def create_link(

**üéâ –ì–û–¢–û–í–û! –î–æ–±–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω—ã –Ω–æ–≤—ã–µ –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å–≤—è–∑—è–º–∏:**

## ‚úÖ **–ù–æ–≤—ã–µ –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã:**

### **1. üóëÔ∏è `delete_link`** - –£–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å–≤—è–∑–µ–π
- **–¢–æ—á–Ω–æ–µ —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ** –∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö [[wikilinks]]
- **Bidirectional removal** - —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤ –æ–±–µ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—ã
- **All instances** - —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤—Å–µ—Ö —ç–∫–∑–µ–º–ø–ª—è—Ä–æ–≤ —Å–≤—è–∑–∏
- **Safe parsing** - —Å–æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω—è–µ—Ç —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ

### **2. üìã `list_links`** - –ü—Ä–æ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä —Å–≤—è–∑–µ–π  
- **Outlinks** - –∏—Å—Ö–æ–¥—è—â–∏–µ —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–∏ [[–∏–∑ –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–∫–∏]]
- **Backlinks** - –≤—Ö–æ–¥—è—â–∏–µ —Å—Å—ã–ª–∫–∏ –Ω–∞ –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–∫—É
- **Context** - –æ–∫—Ä—É–∂–∞—é—â–∏–π —Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–π —Å–≤—è–∑–∏
- **Connection strength** - –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑ —Å–∏–ª—ã —Å–≤—è–∑–µ–π

–¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å **API —Å–∏–º–º–µ—Ç—Ä–∏—á–Ω—ã–π**:
- ‚úÖ `create_link` - —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å–≤—è–∑–µ–π
- ‚úÖ `delete_link` - —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å–≤—è–∑–µ–π

+                 for other_path in list_note_paths(vault_path):
+                     if other_path.stem == title:
+                         continue  # Skip self
+                     
+                     try:
+                         content = other_path.read_text(encoding='utf-8')
+                         outlinks = extract_outlinks(content)
+                         if title in outlinks:
+                             backlinks.append(other_path.stem)
+                     except:
+                         continue
+                 
+                 if backlinks:
+                     return {
+                         "success": False,
+                         "error": f"Cannot delete '{title}' - note has incoming links",
+                         "backlinks": backlinks,
+                         "suggestion": "Use delete_link to remove connections first, or use force_delete=True",
+                         "note_path": str(note_path.relative_to(vault_path))
+                     }
+                         
+             except Exception:
+                 # Backlink check failed, but we can still delete
+                 pass
+             
+             # Perform deletion
+             note_path.unlink()
+             
+             return {
+                 "success": True,
+                 "deleted": title,
+                 "path": str(note_path.relative_to(vault_path)),
+                 "message": f"Successfully deleted '{title}'"
+             }
+             
+         except Exception as e:
+             return {
+                 "success": False,
+                 "error": f"Failed to delete note: {str(e)}",
+                 "title": title
+             }
  
      @mcp.tool()
```

</details>

---

‚ú® –≠–º–æ–¥–∑–∏ –≤ –Ω–∞–∑–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è—Ö —Ç–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏–≤–∞—é—Ç—Å—è

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>–ê–≥–∞! –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å —è –≤–∏–∂—É —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω—É—é –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º—É - —ç—Ç–æ **encoding issue**:
